content: piece cool for about 30 minutes or until dry then unpin from the blocking mat pictured is my mushroom bottle pattern in the video tutorial process of blocking this pattern is available on etsy ravelry & ko-fi https //youtube com/shorts/5qui5wm1rzs adding fringe start by cutting several strands of yarn approximately double the length that you want your fringe to be i cut mine about 10 inches long to give enough length for trimming and shaping at the end each section of fringe should consist of at least 3 strands of yarn and i typically will space my fringe sections every 2-3 stitches video tutorial https //youtube com/shorts/43sp2w4vbts © 2024 earth hand & fiber page 7 finishing mounting to a dowel there are several methods for mounting a tapestry to a dowel but i find the easiest method is to sew it on using a tapestry needle using the long yarn reserved after fastening off your tapestry thread the end of your yarn into a tapestry needle if you did not reserve any yarn cut a piece of yarn approximately 5 times the length of your dowel and join one end of your yarn to the upper right corner of your piece thread the other end of your yarn into your tapestry needle loop your yarn around the dowel and insert your needle through the first chain space of your border pulling the yarn all the way through loop the yarn around the dowel again and insert into the next chain space repeat this process across your piece then fasten_off to secure the yarn video tutorial https //youtube com/shorts/7zmvmqijffs congratulations your tapestry is complete i would love
